N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 §§ 1100-8.9 - Ex parte rule

State Regulations
(a) Except as
provided below, an ALJ shall not directly or through a representative, communicate with any person in connection with any issue that relates in any
way to the merits of the proceeding without providing notice and an opportunity
for all parties to participate. (b) An ALJ may consult on questions of law or procedures with supervisors or other
staff in the Office of hearings, provided that such supervisors or staff have
not been engaged in investigative or prosecutorial functions in connection with
the adjudicatory proceeding under consideration or a factually related
adjudicatory proceeding. (c) An ALJ
and the Chief ALJ may communicate with any person on ministerial matters, such
as scheduling or the location of a hearing. (d) Parties or their representatives shall
not communicate with the ALJ, the Chief ALJ or the Executive Director, or any
person advising or consulting with any of them, in connection with any issue
without providing proper notice to all the other parties. Notes
